description: From shuttle (from the back-and-forth sense of the word originating with loom weaving) + cock (from resemblance to a male bird's plume of tail feathers).

entries.meaning: (countable) A lightweight object that is conical in shape with a cork or rubber-covered nose, used in badminton the way a ball is used in other racquet games. [from early 16th c.]

examples: Two people stand at opposite ends of the room, as in playing shuttlecock [â€¦]

verbs.description: shuttlecock (third-person singular simple present shuttlecocks, present participle shuttlecocking, simple past and past participle shuttlecocked)

entries.meaning: To move rapidly back and forth.
To send or toss back and forth; to bandy.
